## `r rmarkdown::metadata$title`

<div class="row justify-content-center">
<div class="col-lg-8">

<!-- Only text to change below, the rest comes from the YAML --> 
A grid plot is a type of visualization that shows progress towards a target or a completion percentage. The value (percentage) is represented by a grid of coloured small cells. Multiple grid plot can be put together to show the differences among percentages.

More about: <a href="../../chart_gallery/`r params$url_cat`.html#`r params$url_chart`">`r params$chart_type`</a>

<section class="my-5">

### Grid plot small muliples

<div class="row">

<!-- First column for large screen --> 
<div class="col-lg-6">

```{r grid_code, echo=TRUE, fig.show = 'hide', warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
# Loading required packages
library(unhcrthemes)
library(tidyverse)
# install.packages("waffle", repos = "https://cinc.rud.is")
library(waffle)


# Loading data
df <- read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/GDS-ODSSS/unhcr-dataviz-platform/master/data/part_to_a_whole/gridplot_multiple.csv") |> 
  mutate(coping_short = stringr::str_wrap(coping_mechanism,
                                          width = 25))



# Plot
ggplot(df) +
  geom_waffle(aes(fill = category, values = households_num),
              make_proportional = TRUE,
              flip = TRUE,
              color = "white",
              size = .5
              ) +
  labs(
    title = "Top 5 negative coping mechanisms",
    subtitle = "Percentage of households",
    caption = "Source: UNHCR Post-distribution Monitoring for Cash-based Assistance, January 2021\nÂ© UNHCR, The UN Refugee Agency"
  ) +
  scale_fill_unhcr_d(palette = "pal_unhcr") +
  coord_equal() +
  facet_wrap(~coping_short, ncol = 2) +
  theme_unhcr(axis = FALSE, grid = FALSE, axis_text = FALSE, font_size = 13)
```

</div>
